main event: A single object resembling a bright star was observed moving across the sky for 15 minutes at the Gunneson National Monument.
interesting points: The object varied in speed and followed a zig zag course,The sighting occurred at night under clear weather conditions,The observer reported the object disappearing over the eastern horizon,No physical evidence or photographs were recorded,The object was concluded to be the ECHO I satellite.
location: Gunneson National Monument, New Mexico, USA
witness description: One civilian (Mr. Dearborn, a salt miner) and one military officer (Lt. Col. William P. Ault, USAF Ret.)
